intro: Capillipedium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered capillipedium, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific habitats. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare species in its native range.
